column1: Rohri  (Sindhi: روهڙي; Urdu: روہڑی‎) is a city of Sukkur District
column3: Pakistan. It is located on the east bank of the Indus River
column5: the third largest city in Sindh. Rohri town is the administrative headquarters of Rohri Taluka
column6: a tehsil of Sukkur District with which it forms a metropolitan area.

column1: Rohri is 10 kilometres (6.2 miles) west of the ancient city of Aror. Roruka
column2: as capital of the Sauvira Kingdom
column3: is mentioned as an important trading center in early Buddhist literature. Little is known about the city's history prior to the Arab invasion in the 8th century
column4: but Aror was the capital of the Ror Dynasty
column5: which was followed by Rai Dynasty and then the Brahman Dynasty that once ruled northern Sindh.

column2: Aror was captured by the army of Muslim general Muhammad bin Qasim. In 962 CE
column3: a massive earthquake struck the region
column4: causing the course of the Indus River to shift. Aror was re-founded as Rohri afterwards.Rohri served as a busy port along the Indus by the 1200s
column5: and was a major trading centre for agricultural produce.

column1: Rohri has a hot desert climate (Köppen climate classification BWh) with extremely hot summers and mild winters. Rohri is very dry
column2: with the little rain it receives mostly falling in the monsoon season from July to September. The average annual rainfall of Rohri is 105.8 mm as per 1991-2020 period. The highest annual rainfall ever is 452.3 mm
